intro: Stengelia schimperi, commonly known as the Ethiopian milkweed, is a herbaceous plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its milky sap, which is a common feature in plants of this family. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are opposite and oval-shaped, while the flowers are clustered in umbels and often display shades of yellow or green. Stengelia schimperi is also noted for its medicinal properties, used traditionally in local remedies.
